file_content.text: We'll be tracking the Morgukai offworld. Let's hope they don't come back here.
I'll be. You actually made it.
I'll admit, I expected you to die in "honorable battle." Thought that might have kept the Morgukai satisfied for a while.
But if you really dealt them a blow, then the cult is through with training initiates--at least for now.
If you didn't expect me to survive, you should've warned me.
You didn't think I'd succeed!
Maybe. But you did survive.
Good news.
For a bunch of cultists, the Morgukai kept things lively.
I always enjoy a good fight.
You might spar with them again someday. I doubt we've seen the last of them.
Now if you'll excuse me, I have a report to file. And you've got your own mission to complete.
The Morgukai will kill you if they see an opening. Don't give it to them.
You people are drawing a lot of attention. Glad I caught up with you.
I was hoping I'd catch up with you. You're the Jedi working on General Var Suthra's problem.
I was hoping I'd catch up with you. You're the Jedi who made it into the temple on Coruscant.
I was hoping I'd catch up with you. You're the new members of Havoc Squad.
I was hoping I'd catch up with you. You've done a lot of favors for the Republic lately.
Have you been hunting me down?
How'd you find me?
My employers flagged that you were in the area. I saw an opportunity.
I'm not who you want.
I'm not that bad at my job. Don't worry, I'm on your side.
The death cult of the Morgukai is here. Honor-bound warriors from the Nikto homeworld. I ran into them once... a long time ago.
I know about the cult. Some sort of Jedi-hunters?
I've heard of the Morgukai.
Jedi, and anyone else who's worthy prey. Their rituals would give you nightmares--fanatics bleed themselves in the Kintan forests to mark their territory.
I've never heard of the Morgukai.
Morgukai?
They're fanatics. Build their own weapons, spend a month fasting in the Fire-desert of Kinklath. Favorite prey is Jedi.
Sounds like you have a story.
I try to avoid death cultists when I can.
I'll keep my distance.
So do I. Sometimes it doesn't work out.
Years back, the Morgukai took me prisoner in order to lure a worthy opponent--a Jedi. They killed her, then let me go.
Now they're training other Nikto on Nar Shaddaa to hunt and kill Republic targets. Someone has to stop them at their temple and drive them offworld.
I've walked in darkness before. The Morgukai won't stop me.
I'll go to the temple.
Ritual is a powerful thing that shouldn't be underestimated. But I'll go.
An interesting challenge.
Whatever training they've got, it's no Republic boot camp.
I'll handle these cultists.
You could say the same about the Sith Academy, but we don't get cocky around them, either.
You want these guys out, put the money on the table.
For the right price, sure.
Not a problem. Sometimes an unconventional attack is the best one.
These cultists--you said they were honorable. Maybe we can talk to them.
Isn't there a peaceful option?
I guarantee they'll try to kill you on sight.
The temple's not far--some sort of converted warehouse. Good luck in there.
No way. [Refuse quest.]
I can't really blame you. I'll handle this another way; hope the body count doesn't get too high.
We shouldn't talk now, and you've got business of your own.
I have observational authority over the Nikto Sector. You can call me Tythan. I'm sorry to report we have a problem.
What gives you "observational authority"?
Who's "we"?
Section 12a of the Republic Security and Deep Space Monitoring Act. I'm on your side.
The Nikto--main species in this part of the city--they've never liked the Republic. But things just got a lot worse.
Sounds like you need help.
